member.name: P:Godot.EditorFileDialog.Access
member.summary: The location from which the user may select a file, including [code]res://[/code], [code]user://[/code], and the local file system.

member.name: P:Godot.EditorFileDialog.DisplayMode
member.summary: The view format in which the [code]EditorFileDialog[/code] displays resources to the user.

member.name: P:Godot.EditorFileDialog.Mode
member.summary: The purpose of the [code]EditorFileDialog[/code]. Changes allowed behaviors.

member.name: P:Godot.EditorFileDialog.CurrentDir
member.summary: The currently occupied directory.

member.name: P:Godot.EditorFileDialog.CurrentFile
member.summary: The currently selected file.

member.name: P:Godot.EditorFileDialog.CurrentPath
member.summary: The file system path in the address bar.

member.name: P:Godot.EditorFileDialog.ShowHiddenFiles
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] hidden files and directories will be visible in the [code]EditorFileDialog[/code].

member.name: P:Godot.EditorFileDialog.DisableOverwriteWarning
member.summary: If [code]true[/code] the [code]EditorFileDialog[/code] will not warn the user before overwriting files.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileDialog.ClearFilters
member.summary: Removes all filters except for "All Files (*)".

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileDialog.AddFilter(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a comma-delimited file extension filter option to the [code]EditorFileDialog[/code] with an optional semi-colon-delimited label. Example: "*.tscn, *.scn; Scenes", results in filter text "Scenes (*.tscn, *.scn)".

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileDialog.GetVbox
member.summary: Returns the [code]VBoxContainer[/code] used to display the file system.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileDialog.Invalidate
member.summary: Notify the [code]EditorFileDialog[/code] that its view of the data is no longer accurate. Updates the view contents on next view update.

member.name: T:Godot.EditorFileSystem
member.summary: This object holds information of all resources in the filesystem, their types, etc.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystem.GetFilesystem
member.summary: Get the root directory object.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystem.IsScanning
member.summary: Return true of the filesystem is being scanned.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystem.GetScanningProgress
member.summary: Return the scan progress for 0 to 1 if the FS is being scanned.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystem.Scan
member.summary: Scan the filesystem for changes.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystem.ScanSources
member.summary: Check if the source of any imported resource changed.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystem.UpdateFile(System.String)
member.summary: Update a file information. Call this if an external program (not Godot) modified the file.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystem.GetFilesystemPath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a view into the filesystem at [code]path[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystem.GetFileType(System.String)
member.summary: Get the type of the file, given the full path.

member.name: T:Godot.EditorFileSystemDirectory
member.summary: A more generalized, low-level variation of the directory concept.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystemDirectory.GetSubdirCount
member.summary: Returns the number of subdirectories in this directory.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystemDirectory.GetSubdir(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the subdirectory at index [code]idx[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystemDirectory.GetFileCount
member.summary: Returns the number of files in this directory.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystemDirectory.GetFile(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the name of the file at index [code]idx[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystemDirectory.GetFilePath(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the path to the file at index [code]idx[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystemDirectory.GetFileType(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the file extension of the file at index [code]idx[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystemDirectory.GetFileImportIsValid(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns [code]true[/code] if the file at index [code]idx[/code] imported properly.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystemDirectory.GetName
member.summary: Returns the name of this directory.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystemDirectory.GetPath
member.summary: Returns the path to this directory.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystemDirectory.GetParent
member.summary: Returns the parent directory for this directory or null if called on a directory at [code]res://[/code] or [code]user://[/code].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystemDirectory.FindFileIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the index of the file with name [code]name[/code] or [code]-1[/code] if not found.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorFileSystemDirectory.FindDirIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the index of the directory with name [code]name[/code] or [code]-1[/code] if not found.

member.name: T:Godot.EditorImportPlugin
M:Godot.EditorImportPlugin.GetImportOptions(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the options and default values for the preset at this index. Returns an Array of Dictionaries with the following keys: "name", "default_value", "property_hint" (optional), "hint_string" (optional), "usage" (optional).

member.name: M:Godot.EditorImportPlugin.GetImportOrder
member.summary: Get the order of this importer to be run when importing resources. Higher values will be called later. Use this to ensure the importer runs after the dependencies are already imported.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorImportPlugin.GetImporterName
member.summary: Get the unique name of the importer.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorImportPlugin.GetPresetCount
member.summary: Get the number of initial presets defined by the plugin. Use [method get_import_options] to get the default options for the preset and [method get_preset_name] to get the name of the preset.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorImportPlugin.GetPresetName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the name of the options preset at this index.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorImportPlugin.GetPriority
member.summary: Get the priority of this plugin for the recognized extension. Higher priority plugins will be preferred. Default value is 1.0.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorImportPlugin.GetRecognizedExtensions
member.summary: Get the list of file extensions to associate with this loader (case insensitive). e.g. ["obj"].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorImportPlugin.GetResourceType
member.summary: Get the godot resource type associated with this loader. e.g. "Mesh" or "Animation".

member.name: M:Godot.EditorImportPlugin.GetSaveExtension
member.summary: Get the extension used to save this resource in the [code].import[/code] directory.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorImportPlugin.GetVisibleName
member.summary: Get the name to display in the import window.

member.name: T:Godot.EditorInterface
member.summary: Editor interface. Allows saving and (re-)loading scenes, rendering mesh previews, inspecting and editing resources and objects and provides access to [EditorSettings], [EditorFileSystem], [EditorResourcePreview]\ er, [ScriptEditor], the editor viewport, as well as information about scenes. Also see [EditorPlugin] and [EditorScript].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.InspectObject(Godot.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Shows the given property on the given [code]object[/code] in the Editor's Inspector dock.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.GetSelection
member.summary: Returns the [EditorSelection].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.GetEditorSettings
member.summary: Returns the [EditorSettings].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.GetScriptEditor
member.summary: Returns the [ScriptEditor].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.GetBaseControl
member.summary: Returns the base [Control].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.EditResource(Godot.Resource)
member.summary: Edits the given [Resource].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.OpenSceneFromPath(System.String)
member.summary: Opens the scene at the given path.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.ReloadSceneFromPath(System.String)
member.summary: Reloads the scene at the given path.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.GetOpenScenes
member.summary: Returns an [Array] of the currently opened scenes.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.GetEditedSceneRoot
member.summary: Returns the edited scene's root [Node].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.GetResourcePreviewer
member.summary: Returns the [EditorResourcePreview]\ er.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.GetResourceFilesystem
member.summary: Returns the [EditorFileSystem].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.GetEditorViewport
member.summary: Returns the editor [Viewport].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.MakeMeshPreviews(Godot.Array,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns mesh previews rendered at the given size as an [Array] of [Texture]s.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.SetPluginEnabled(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the enabled status of a plugin. The plugin name is the same as its directory name.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.IsPluginEnabled(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the enabled status of a plugin. The plugin name is the same as its directory name.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.SaveScene
member.summary: Saves the scene. Returns either OK or ERR_CANT_CREATE. See [@GlobalScope] constants.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorInterface.SaveSceneAs(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves the scene as a file at [code]path[/code].

member.name: T:Godot.EditorPlugin
member.summary: Plugins are used by the editor to extend functionality. The most common types of plugins are those which edit a given node or resource type, import plugins and export plugins.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.ApplyChanges
member.summary: This method is called when the editor is about to save the project, switch to another tab, etc. It asks the plugin to apply any pending state changes to ensure consistency. This is used, for example, in shader editors to let the plugin know that it must apply the shader code being written by the user to the object.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.Clear
member.summary: Clear all the state and reset the object being edited to zero. This ensures your plugin does not keep editing a currently existing node, or a node from the wrong scene.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.CreateSpatialGizmo(Godot.Spatial)
member.summary: This is used for plugins that create gizmos used by the spatial editor. Just check that the node passed in the "for_spatial" argument matches your plugin.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.Edit(Godot.Object)
member.summary: This function is used for plugins that edit specific object types (nodes or resources). It requests the editor to edit the given object.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.ForwardSpatialGuiInput(Godot.Camera,Godot.InputEvent)
member.summary: Implement this function if you are interested in 3D view screen input events. It will be called only if currently selected node is handled by your plugin. If you would like to always gets those input events then additionally use [method set_input_forwarding_always_enabled].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.GetBreakpoints
member.summary: This is for editors that edit script based objects. You can return a list of breakpoints in the format (script:line), for example: res://path_to_script.gd:25

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.GetState
member.summary: Get the state of your plugin editor. This is used when saving the scene (so state is kept when opening it again) and for switching tabs (so state can be restored when the tab returns).

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.GetWindowLayout(Godot.ConfigFile)
member.summary: Get the GUI layout of the plugin. This is used to save the project's editor layout when the [method EditorPlugin.queue_save_layout] is called or the editor layout was changed(For example changing the position of a dock).

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.Handles(Godot.Object)
member.summary: Implement this function if your plugin edits a specific type of object (Resource or Node). If you return true, then you will get the functions [method EditorPlugin.edit] and [method EditorPlugin.make_visible] called when the editor requests them.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.HasMainScreen
member.summary: Return true if this is a main screen editor plugin (it goes in the main screen selector together with 2D, 3D, Script).

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.MakeVisible(System.Boolean)
member.summary: This function will be called when the editor is requested to become visible. It is used for plugins that edit a specific object type. Remember that you have to manage the visibility of all your editor controls manually.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.SaveExternalData
member.summary: This method is called after the editor saves the project or when it's closed. It asks the plugin to save edited external scenes/resources.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.SetState(Godot.Dictionary)
member.summary: Restore the state saved by [method EditorPlugin.get_state].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.SetWindowLayout(Godot.ConfigFile)
member.summary: Restore the plugin GUI layout saved by [method EditorPlugin.get_window_layout].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.AddControlToContainer(Godot.EditorPlugin.CustomControlContainer,Godot.Control)
member.summary: Add a custom control to a container (see CONTAINER_* enum). There are many locations where custom controls can be added in the editor UI. Please remember that you have to manage the visibility of your custom controls yourself (and likely hide it after adding it). If your plugin is being removed, also make sure to remove your custom controls too.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.AddControlToBottomPanel(Godot.Control,System.String)
member.summary: Add a control to the bottom panel (together with Output, Debug, Animation, etc). Returns a reference to the button added. It's up to you to hide/show the button when needed. If your plugin is being removed, also make sure to remove your control by calling [method remove_control_from_bottom_panel].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.AddControlToDock(Godot.EditorPlugin.DockSlot,Godot.Control)
member.summary: Add the control to a specific dock slot (see DOCK_* enum for options). If the dock is repositioned and as long as the plugin is active, the editor will save the dock position on further sessions. If your plugin is being removed, also make sure to remove your control by calling [method remove_control_from_docks].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.RemoveControlFromDocks(Godot.Control)
member.summary: Remove the control from the dock. Don't forget to call this if you added one, so the editor can save the layout and remove it cleanly.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.RemoveControlFromBottomPanel(Godot.Control)
member.summary: Remove the control from the bottom panel. Don't forget to call this if you added one, so the editor can remove it cleanly.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.RemoveControlFromContainer(Godot.EditorPlugin.CustomControlContainer,Godot.Control)
member.summary: Remove the control from the specified container. Use it when cleaning up after adding a control with [method add_control_to_container]. Note that you can simply free the control if you won't use it anymore.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.AddCustomType(System.String,System.String,Godot.Script,Godot.Texture)
member.summary: Add a custom type, which will appear in the list of nodes or resources. An icon can be optionally passed. When given node or resource is selected, the base type will be instanced (ie, "Spatial", "Control", "Resource"), then the script will be loaded and set to this object. You can use the [method EditorPlugin.handles] to check if your custom object is being edited by checking the script or using 'is' keyword. During run-time, this will be a simple object with a script so this function does not need to be called then.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.RemoveCustomType(System.String)
member.summary: Remove a custom type added by [method EditorPlugin.add_custom_type]

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.GetUndoRedo
member.summary: Get the undo/redo object. Most actions in the editor can be undoable, so use this object to make sure this happens when it's worth it.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.QueueSaveLayout
member.summary: Queue save the project's editor layout.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorPlugin.SetInputEventForwardingAlwaysEnabled
member.summary: Use this method if you always want to receive inputs from 3D view screen inside [method forward_spatial_gui_input]. It might be especially usable if your plugin will want to use raycast in the scene.

member.name: T:Godot.EditorResourcePreview
member.summary: This object is used to generate previews for resources of files.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorResourcePreview.QueueResourcePreview(System.String,Godot.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Queue a resource file for preview (using a path). Once the preview is ready, your receiver.receiver_func will be called either containing the preview texture or an empty texture (if no preview was possible). Callback must have the format: (path,texture,userdata). Userdata can be anything.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorResourcePreview.QueueEditedResourcePreview(Godot.Resource,Godot.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Queue a resource being edited for preview (using an instance). Once the preview is ready, your receiver.receiver_func will be called either containing the preview texture or an empty texture (if no preview was possible). Callback must have the format: (path,texture,userdata). Userdata can be anything.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorResourcePreview.AddPreviewGenerator(Godot.EditorResourcePreviewGenerator)
member.summary: Create an own, custom preview generator.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorResourcePreview.RemovePreviewGenerator(Godot.EditorResourcePreviewGenerator)
member.summary: Remove a custom preview generator.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorResourcePreview.CheckForInvalidation(System.String)
member.summary: Check if the resource changed, if so it will be invalidated and the corresponding signal emitted.

member.name: T:Godot.EditorResourcePreviewGenerator
member.summary: Custom code to generate previews. Please check "file_dialog/thumbnail_size" in EditorSettings to find out the right size to do previews at.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorResourcePreviewGenerator.Generate(Godot.Resource)
member.summary: Generate a preview from a given resource. This must be always implemented. Returning an empty texture is an OK way to fail and let another generator take care. Care must be taken because this function is always called from a thread (not the main thread).

member.name: M:Godot.EditorResourcePreviewGenerator.GenerateFromPath(System.String)
member.summary: Generate a preview directly from a path, implementing this is optional, as default code will load and call generate() Returning an empty texture is an OK way to fail and let another generator take care. Care must be taken because this function is always called from a thread (not the main thread).

member.name: M:Godot.EditorResourcePreviewGenerator.Handles(System.String)
member.summary: Return if your generator supports this resource type.

member.name: T:Godot.EditorScript
member.summary: Scripts extending this class and implementing its [code]_run()[/code] method can be executed from the Script Editor's [code]File -> Run[/code] menu option (or by pressing [code]CTRL+Shift+X[/code]) while the editor is running. This is useful for adding custom in-editor functionality to Godot. For more complex additions, consider using [EditorPlugin]s instead. Note that extending scripts need to have [code]tool mode[/code] enabled. Example script: [codeblock] tool extends EditorScript func _run(): print("Hello from the Godot Editor!") [/codeblock] Note that the script is run in the Editor context, which means the output is visible in the console window started with the Editor (STDOUT) instead of the usual Godot [i]Output[/i] dock.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorScript._Run
member.summary: This method is executed by the Editor when [code]File -> Run[/code] is used.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorScript.AddRootNode(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Adds [code]node[/code] as a child of the root node in the editor context. WARNING: The implementation of this method is currently disabled.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorScript.GetScene
member.summary: Returns the Editor's currently active scene.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorScript.GetEditorInterface
member.summary: Returns the [EditorInterface] singleton instance.

member.name: T:Godot.EditorSelection
member.summary: This object manages the SceneTree selection in the editor.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSelection.Clear
member.summary: Clear the selection.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSelection.AddNode(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Add a node to the selection.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSelection.RemoveNode(Godot.Node)
member.summary: Remove a node from the selection.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSelection.GetSelectedNodes
member.summary: Get the list of selected nodes.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSelection.GetTransformableSelectedNodes
member.summary: Get the list of selected nodes, optimized for transform operations (ie, moving them, rotating, etc). This list avoids situations where a node is selected and also chid/grandchild.

member.name: T:Godot.EditorSettings
member.summary: Object that holds the project-independent editor settings. These settings are generally visible in the Editor Settings menu. Accessing the settings is done by using the regular [Object] API, such as: [codeblock] settings.set(prop,value) settings.get(prop) list_of_settings = settings.get_property_list() [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSettings.Erase(System.String)
member.summary: Erase a given setting (pass full property path).

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSettings.AddPropertyInfo(Godot.Dictionary)
member.summary: Add a custom property info to a property. The dictionary must contain: name:[String](the name of the property) and type:[int](see TYPE_* in [@GlobalScope]), and optionally hint:[int](see PROPERTY_HINT_* in [@GlobalScope]), hint_string:[String]. Example: [codeblock] editor_settings.set("category/property_name", 0) var property_info = { "name": "category/property_name", "type": TYPE_INT, "hint": PROPERTY_HINT_ENUM, "hint_string": "one,two,three" } editor_settings.add_property_info(property_info) [/codeblock]

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSettings.GetSettingsDir
member.summary: Get the global settings path for the engine. Inside this path you can find some standard paths such as: settings/tmp - used for temporary storage of files settings/templates - where export templates are located

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSettings.GetProjectSettingsDir
member.summary: Get the specific project settings path. Projects all have a unique sub-directory inside the settings path where project specific settings are saved.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSettings.SetFavoriteDirs(System.String[])
member.summary: Set the list of favorite directories for this project.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSettings.GetFavoriteDirs
member.summary: Get the list of favorite directories for this project.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSettings.SetRecentDirs(System.String[])
member.summary: Set the list of recently visited folders in the file dialog for this project.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSettings.GetRecentDirs
member.summary: Get the list of recently visited folders in the file dialog for this project.

member.name: T:Godot.EditorSpatialGizmo
member.summary: Custom gizmo that is used for providing custom visualization and editing (handles) for 3D Spatial objects. These are created by [method EditorPlugin.create_spatial_gizmo].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSpatialGizmo.CommitHandle(System.Int32,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Commit a handle being edited (handles must have been previously added by [method add_handles]). If the cancel parameter is true, an option to restore the edited value to the original is provided.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSpatialGizmo.GetHandleName(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get the name of an edited handle (handles must have been previously added by [method add_handles]). Handles can be named for reference to the user when editing.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSpatialGizmo.GetHandleValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get actual value of a handle. This value can be anything and used for eventually undoing the motion when calling [method commit_handle]

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSpatialGizmo.Redraw
member.summary: This function is called when the Spatial this gizmo refers to changes (the [method Spatial.update_gizmo] is called).

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSpatialGizmo.SetHandle(System.Int32,Godot.Camera,Godot.Vector2)
member.summary: This function is used when the user drags a gizmo handle (previously added with [method add_handles]) in screen coordinates. The [Camera] is also provided so screen coordinates can be converted to raycasts.

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSpatialGizmo.AddLines(Godot.Vector3[],Godot.Material,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add lines to the gizmo (as sets of 2 points), with a given material. The lines are used for visualizing the gizmo. Call this function during [method redraw].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSpatialGizmo.AddMesh(Godot.ArrayMesh,System.Boolean,Godot.RID)
member.summary: <param name="skeleton">If the param is null, then the default value is new RID()</param>

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSpatialGizmo.AddCollisionTriangles(Godot.TriangleMesh,Godot.AABB)
member.summary: Add collision triangles to the gizmo for picking. A [TriangleMesh] can be generated from a regular [Mesh] too. Call this function during [method redraw].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSpatialGizmo.AddUnscaledBillboard(Godot.Material,System.Single)
member.summary: Add an unscaled billboard for visualization. Call this function during [method redraw].

member.name: M:Godot.EditorSpatialGizmo.AddHandles(Godot.Vector3[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add a list of handles (points) which can be used to deform the object being edited. There are virtual functions which will be called upon editing of these handles. Call this function during [method redraw].

member.name: M:Godot.ScriptEditor.GetCurrentScript
member.summary: Returns a [Script] that is currently active in editor.

member.name: M:Godot.ScriptEditor.GetOpenScripts
member.summary: Returns an array with all [Script] objects which are currently open in editor.

member.name: M:Godot.VisualScriptEditor.AddCustomNode(System.String,System.String,Godot.Script)
member.summary: Add a custom Visual Script node to the editor. It'll be placed under "Custom Nodes" with the [code]category[/code] as the parameter.

member.name: M:Godot.VisualScriptEditor.RemoveCustomNode(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Remove a custom Visual Script node from the editor. Custom nodes already placed on scripts won't be removed.
